thread.title: Police find man who disappeared after flying into Atlanta
thread.title_full: Police find man who disappeared after flying into Atlanta

author: Lauren Foreman
title: Police find man who disappeared after flying into Atlanta
text:
A man who man who went missing shortly after he flew into Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport was found in a wooded area near the airport.
Atlanta police found Raymond Makowski, 55, in a wooded area they had already searched. He was found unharmed.
#Breaking : @Atlanta_Police have confirmed officers just found Mr. Makowski in a wooded area near Airport Blvd 14 hours after landing. üôèüèæ pic.twitter.com/U8ASd9theL
‚Äî Nefertiti J√°quez (@NefertitiWSB) February 20, 2017 A Mattie‚Äôs Call had been issued for him shortly after his flight landed, police said. He arrived in Atlanta just before 1:20 p.m. Sunday, police said.
Police have not said where Makowski came from. His brother-in-law reported him missing, police said.
According to Channel 2 Action News, he has dementia.
An off-duty @Atlanta_Police SGT acted on a gut instinct + revisited a wooded area #APD had been searching + found the missing man. @wsbtv pic.twitter.com/XH9zw01azR
‚Äî Nefertiti J√°quez (@NefertitiWSB) February 20, 2017
